title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 25 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Vandenberg SFB
summary: The Starlink 17-32 mission will be the first Starlink mission in February. Liftoff from pad 4E at Vandenberg Space Force Base is scheduled for 7:38 a.m. PST (10:38 a.m. EST / 1538 UTC).

title: Countdown underway for critical moon rocket fueling test Monday
summary: The countdown began Saturday evening and will continue through the start of a simulated launch window opening at 9 p.m. EST Monday. The test started two days late because of predicted arctic weather along Florida's Space Coast.

title: With attention on orbital data centers, the focus turns to economics
summary:
One of the biggest questions in the tech sector has been if AI is the future, where does all the infrastructure go? Some space industry leaders — including Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos — believe the answer could be in orbit, via space-based data centers. That idea has gained attention in recent weeks. Musk is […]

title: Varda’s W-5 mission lands in Australia
summary:
Varda Space Industries completed its latest reentry mission Jan. 29, completing an end-to-end demonstration of a new in-house spacecraft design.

title: SpaceX files plans for million-satellite orbital data center constellation
summary:
SpaceX is seeking Federal Communications Commission approval for a satellite constellation of unprecedented scale intended to function as an orbital data center.

title: China launches AlSat-3B for Algeria, further launches delayed ahead of key human spaceflight test
summary:

title: NASA advances space based tracking of marine debris
summary:
Los Angeles CA (SPX) Jan 28, 2026


Detergent bottles and other litter can travel thousands of miles across the ocean before washing up on remote islands like Kaho'olawe in Hawaii, highlighting how persistent plastic pollution has become in the marine environment. title: Leonardo DRS infrared payloads selected for SDA Tracking Layer Tranche 3
summary:
Los Angeles CA (SPX) Jan 29, 2026


Leonardo DRS has been awarded a subcontract to deliver advanced infrared mission payloads for the Space Development Agency's Tracking Layer Tranche 3, expanding space-based support for the U.S. missile defense architecture.
